00233 /* ------------------------------------------*
00234  *        Barrier management.
00235  * ------------------------------------------*/
00236 
00237 #define P( _mutex_ ) pthread_mutex_lock( &_mutex_ )
00238 #define V( _mutex_ ) pthread_mutex_unlock( &_mutex_ )
00239 
00240 /* variables for managing barriers */
00241 
00242 /* barrier protection */
00243 static pthread_mutex_t  barrier_mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER ;
00244 
00245 /* condition for crossing barrier */
00246 static pthread_cond_t   barrier_cond = PTHREAD_COND_INITIALIZER ;
00247 
00248 /* total number of threads to wait for */
00249 static int total_nb_threads = -1 ; /* -1 = not initialized */
00250 
00251 /* number of threads that reached the barrier */
00252 static int nb_waiting_threads = 0;
00253 
00254 
00259 int shell_BarrierInit( int nb_threads )
00260 { 
00261   
00262   P( barrier_mutex );
00263   
00264   if ( total_nb_threads == -1 )    
00265   {
00266     total_nb_threads = nb_threads;
00267     V( barrier_mutex );
00268     return SHELL_SUCCESS;    
00269   }
00270   else
00271   {
00272     V( barrier_mutex );
00273     printf( "ganeshell: Error: Barrier already initialized\n");
00274     return SHELL_ERROR;
00275   }
00276 }
00277 
00278 
00279 static int shell_BarrierWait()
00280 {
00281   
00282   P( barrier_mutex );
00283 
00284   /* not used in a single thread environment */
00285   
00286   if ( total_nb_threads == -1 )
00287   {
00288     V( barrier_mutex );
00289     return SHELL_ERROR;
00290   }
00291   
00292   /* increase number of waiting threads */
00293   
00294   nb_waiting_threads ++ ;
00295   
00296   
00297   /* test for condition */
00298   
00299   if ( nb_waiting_threads == total_nb_threads )
00300   {
00301     /* reset the number of waiting threads */
00302     nb_waiting_threads = 0;
00303     
00304     /* wake up all threads */
00305     pthread_cond_broadcast( &barrier_cond );
00306     
00307   }
00308   else
00309     pthread_cond_wait(&barrier_cond,&barrier_mutex);
00310 
00311   /* leaves the critical section */
00312   
00313   V( barrier_mutex );    
00314   
00315   return SHELL_SUCCESS;
00316         
00317 }

00321 /* ------------------------------------------*
00322  *        Thread safety management.

00325 
00326 /* threads keys */
00327 static pthread_key_t thread_key ;
00328 static pthread_once_t once_key = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT ;
00329 
00330 
00331 /* init pthtread_key for current thread */
00332 
00333 static void init_keys( void )
00334 {
00335   if( pthread_key_create( &thread_key, NULL ) == -1 )
00336     printf( "Error %d creating pthread key for thread %p : %s\n",
00337         errno,(caddr_t)pthread_self(),strerror(errno) ) ;
00338   
00339   return ;
00340 } /* init_keys */
00341 
00342 
00347 static shell_state_t  * GetShellContext(){
00348   
00349   shell_state_t * p_current_thread_vars ;
00350   
00351   
00352   /* first, we init the keys if this is the first time */
00353   if( pthread_once( &once_key, init_keys ) != 0 ){
00354     printf( "Error %d calling pthread_once for thread %p : %s\n",
00355         errno,(caddr_t)pthread_self(),strerror(errno) ) ;
00356     return NULL;
00357   }
00358   
00359   p_current_thread_vars = (shell_state_t *)pthread_getspecific( thread_key );
00360   
00361   /* we allocate the thread context if this is the first time */
00362   if (p_current_thread_vars==NULL){
00363       
00364     /* allocates thread structure */
00365     p_current_thread_vars = (shell_state_t *)Mem_Alloc(sizeof(shell_state_t));
00366     
00367     /* panic !!! */
00368     if (p_current_thread_vars == NULL) {
00369       printf( "%p:ganeshell: Not enough memory\n",(caddr_t)pthread_self());
00370       return NULL;
00371     }
00372     
00373     /* Clean thread context */
00374         
00375     memset(  p_current_thread_vars, 0, sizeof( shell_state_t ) );
00376     
00377     /* setting default values */
00378     
00379     p_current_thread_vars->input_stream = stdin;
00380     p_current_thread_vars->interactive = TRUE;
00381     p_current_thread_vars->layer = NULL;
00382     p_current_thread_vars->status = 0;
00383     p_current_thread_vars->verbose = 0;
00384     p_current_thread_vars->debug_level = NIV_EVENT;
00385     p_current_thread_vars->line = 0;
00386   
00387     /* set the specific value */
00388     pthread_setspecific( thread_key , (void *)p_current_thread_vars ) ;
00389     
00390   }
00391  
00392   return p_current_thread_vars ;
00393   
00394 }/* GetShellContext */

00398 /*------------------------------------------------------------------
00399  *                    Main shell routines.

00401 
00407 int shell_Init( int verbose,
00408                 char * input_file,                
00409                 char * prompt,
00410                 int shell_index )
00411 {
00412   
00413   int rc;
00414   char localmachine[256];  
00415   shell_state_t  * context;
00416   
00417   /* First init Buddy Malloc System */
00418   
00419 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00420   
00421   /* Init Buddy allocator */
00422   
00423   if ( ( rc = BuddyInit( NULL )) != BUDDY_SUCCESS )
00424   {
00425     /* can't use shell tracing functions there */
00426     fprintf( stderr, "Error %d initializing Buddy allocator.\n",rc);
00427     return rc;
00428   }
00429   
00430 #endif
00431    
00432   /* Init logging */
00433   
00434   SetNamePgm( "ganeshell" ) ;  
00435   /*if (verbose) */
00436       SetNameFileLog( "/dev/tty" ) ;
00437   /*else
00438       SetNameFileLog( "/dev/null" ) ; */
00439   
00440   SetNameFunction( "shell" ) ;
00441 
00442   /* getting the hostname */
00443   if( gethostname( localmachine, sizeof( localmachine ) ) != 0 )
00444     {
00445       fprintf( stderr, "Error %d calling gethostname.\n",errno );
00446       return errno;
00447     }
00448   else
00449     SetNameHost( localmachine ) ;
00450   
00451   InitDebug( NIV_EVENT ) ;
00452 
00453   
00454   /* retrieve/initialize shell context */
00455   
00456   context = GetShellContext();
00457 
00458   
00459   /* Initializes verbose mode. */
00460   
00461   if ( rc = shell_SetVerbose( context, ( verbose ? "1":"0") ) ) return rc;
00462 
00463   
00464   if ( rc = shell_SetDbgLvl( context, "NIV_EVENT" ) )  return rc;
00465   
00466       
00467   /* Then, initializes input file. */
00468   
00469   if ( rc = shell_SetInput( context, input_file ) )
00470     return rc;
00471   
00472   
00473   /* Initialize prompt */
00474   
00475   if ( rc = shell_SetPrompt( context, prompt ) )
00476     return rc;
00477 
00478   /* Initialize Shell id */
00479  
00480   if ( rc = shell_SetShellId( context, shell_index ) )
00481     return rc;
00482   
00483   
00484   return SHELL_SUCCESS;
00485   
00486 }

00491 /* reads a line from input, and prints a prompt in interactive mode. */
00492 
00493 static char * shell_readline(  shell_state_t  * context, char *s, int n, FILE *stream, int interactive)
00494 {
00495   
00496   char * retval = shell_GetPrompt( context );
00497   char * l;
00498 
00499 #ifdef HAVE_LIBREADLINE
00500   
00501   if ( interactive )
00502   {
00503     /* use readline */
00504     l = readline( (retval?retval:"") );    
00505     if ( l )
00506     {
00507       strncpy( s, l, n );
00508       
00509       /* add line to history, if it is not empty */
00510       l = skipblanks2( l );
00511       
00512       if ( l != NULL ) add_history( l );
00513       
00514       return s;
00515     }
00516     else
00517       return NULL;
00518   }
00519   else
00520     return fgets(s, n, stream);
00521   
00522 #else
00523   if ( interactive )
00524           printf( "%s", (retval?retval:"") );
00525   
00526   return fgets(s, n, stream);
00527 #endif
00528   
00529 }

00531 
00535 int shell_Launch()
00536 {
00537   
00538   char cmdline[MAX_LINE_LEN+1];
00539   char * arglist[MAX_ARGS];
00540   int alloctab[MAX_ARGS];
00541   int argcount;
00542   int rc;
00543   
00544   shell_state_t  * context =   GetShellContext();
00545   
00546   while ( shell_readline( context, cmdline, MAX_LINE_LEN,
00547                           context->input_stream,
00548                           context->interactive) != NULL )
00549   {
00550     
00551     /* Increments line number */
00552     
00553     shell_SetLine( context, shell_GetLine(context) + 1 );
00554     
00555     /* Parse command line */
00556     
00557     if ( shell_ParseLine( cmdline, arglist, &argcount) )
00558       continue;
00559         
00560     /* nothing to do if the line is empty. */
00561     if ( argcount == 0 ) continue;
00562     
00563     /* Evaluates arguments */
00564     
00565     if ( shell_SolveArgs( argcount, arglist, alloctab ) )
00566       continue;
00567     
00568     /* Execute command */
00569     rc = shell_Execute( argcount, arglist, stdout );
00570     
00571     /* clean allocated strings */
00572     shell_CleanArgs( argcount, arglist, alloctab );
00573     
00574     /* set command status */
00575     shell_SetStatus( context, rc );
00576     
00577     
00578   }
00579     
00580 }

00592 
00593 /* address of the first non blank char if any, null else.*/
00594 
00595 static char * skipblanks( char * str )
00596 {
00597 
00598   char * curr = str;
00599   
00600   while(1)
00601   {
00602     
00603     switch(*curr)
00604     {
00605       /* end of lines */
00606       case '\0':
00607       case '#':
00608         return NULL;
00609         
00610       case ' ':
00611       case '\t':
00612       case '\r':  
00613       case '\n':  
00614         curr++;
00615         break;
00616         
00617       default :
00618         return curr;    
00619       
00620     } /* switch */
00621     
00622   } /* while */
00623   
00624 } /* skipblanks */
00625 
00626 
00627 /* the same as previous, except it doesnt not trunc line at # sign */
00628 
00629 static char * skipblanks2( char * str )
00630 {
00631 
00632   char * curr = str;
00633   
00634   while(1)
00635   {
00636     
00637     switch(*curr)
00638     {
00639       /* end of lines */
00640       case '\0':
00641         return NULL;
00642         
00643       case ' ':
00644       case '\t':
00645       case '\r':  
00646       case '\n':  
00647         curr++;
00648         break;
00649         
00650       default :
00651         return curr;    
00652       
00653     } /* switch */
00654     
00655   } /* while */
00656   
00657 } /* skipblanks2 */
00658 
00659 
00660 
00661 /* adress of the first blank char
00662  * outside a string.
00663  */
00664 static char * nextblank( char * str )
00665 {
00666 
00667   int dquote_string =0;
00668   int squote_string =0;
00669   int bquote_string =0;
00670   
00671   int escaped = 0;
00672   
00673   char * curr = str;
00674   
00675   while(1)
00676   {
00677   
00678     switch(*curr)
00679     {
00680 
00681       /* end of lines */
00682       case ' ':
00683       case '\t':        
00684         if (  !dquote_string
00685            && !squote_string
00686            && !bquote_string  ) return curr;
00687         else curr++;
00688         break;
00689         
00690       case '\0':
00691       case '\n':
00692         return curr;
00693         break;
00694       
00695       case '\\':
00696         /* escape sequence */
00697         escaped = 1;
00698         curr++;
00699         break;
00700                 
00701       case '"' :
00702         /* start or end of double quoted string */
00703         if (dquote_string) dquote_string = 0;
00704         else (dquote_string)=1;
00705         curr++;
00706         break;
00707         
00708       case '\'' :
00709         /* start or end of single quoted string */
00710         if (squote_string) squote_string = 0;
00711         else (squote_string)=1;
00712         curr++;
00713         break;
00714         
00715       case '`' :
00716         /* start or end of back-quoted string */
00717         if (bquote_string) bquote_string = 0;
00718         else (bquote_string)=1;
00719         curr++;
00720         break;
00721                 
00722       default :
00723         curr++;
00724          
00725     } /* switch */
00726     
00727     /* escape ? */
00728     
00729     if ( escaped && (*curr != '\0') )
00730     {
00731       escaped = 0;
00732       curr++;
00733     }
00734 
00735     
00736   } /* while */
00737   
00738 } /* nextblank */
00739

00745 
00757 int shell_ParseLine( char * in_out_line, char ** out_arglist, int * p_argcount )
00758 {
00759   
00760     char * curr_pos = in_out_line;
00761     (*p_argcount) = 0;
00762 
00763     /* While there is something after the Oblivion... */
00764     
00765     while ( curr_pos = skipblanks(curr_pos) )
00766     {
00767       out_arglist[(*p_argcount)] = curr_pos;
00768       (*p_argcount) ++;
00769       curr_pos = nextblank(curr_pos);
00770       
00771       if ( *curr_pos=='\0')
00772         break;
00773       else
00774         *curr_pos='\0';
00775       
00776       curr_pos++;
00777     }
00778        
00779     return SHELL_SUCCESS;
00780   
00781 } /* shell_ParseLine */
00782

00785 
00791 static int unescape( char * str )
00792 {
00793     
00794   char * src = str;
00795   char * tgt = str;
00796 
00797   while ( *src != '\0' )
00798   {
00799     if ( *src == '\\' )
00800     {
00801       src ++;
00802       
00803       /* escaped null char */
00804       if (*src == '\0')
00805       {        
00806 #ifdef _DEBUG_SHELL
00807         printf("UNESCAPE ERROR >>>>>>>>>> [%s][%c][%c]\n",str, *src, *tgt );
00808 #endif        
00809         return SHELL_ERROR;
00810       }
00811       
00812     }
00813     
00814     if ( tgt != src )
00815       *tgt = *src;
00816     
00817     src++;
00818     tgt++;
00819   }
00820   
00821   /* final zero */
00822   if ( tgt != src ) 
00823     *tgt=*src;
00824   
00825   return SHELL_SUCCESS;
00826   
00827 }
00828 
00829 
00835 static int remove_quotes( char quote, char ** pstr )
00836 {
00837     
00838   size_t  len = strlen( *pstr );
00839   
00840   if ( len <= 1 ) return SHELL_ERROR;
00841   if ( (*pstr)[len-1] != quote )  return SHELL_ERROR;
00842   
00843   (*pstr)[len-1] = '\0';
00844   (*pstr)[0] = '\0';
00845   
00846   (*pstr) ++;
00847   
00848   return SHELL_SUCCESS; 
00849   
00850 }

00854 
00866 int shell_SolveArgs( int argc, char ** in_out_argv, int * out_allocated )
00867 {
00868   
00869   int i;
00870   int error = 0;
00871   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
00872 
00873   shell_state_t  * context =   GetShellContext();
00874 
00875     
00876 #ifdef _DEBUG_SHELL
00877   printf("SOLVE:");
00878   for (i=0;i<argc;i++)
00879     printf("[%s]",in_out_argv[i]);
00880   printf("\n");
00881 #endif
00882     
00883   for ( i=0; i< argc ; i++)
00884   { 
00885     
00886     out_allocated[i] = FALSE;
00887     
00888     /* double quotes */
00889         
00890     if ( in_out_argv[i][0] == '"' )
00891     {
00892       
00893       if ( remove_quotes( '"', &(in_out_argv[i]) ) )
00894       {
00895         shell_PrintError( context, "Syntax error: Missing closing quotes" );
00896         error = SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
00897         break;
00898       }
00899       
00900       if ( unescape( in_out_argv[i] ) )
00901       {
00902         shell_PrintError( context,"Syntax error: Invalid escape sequence" );
00903         error = SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
00904         break;
00905       }
00906 
00907             
00908     }
00909     
00910     /* single quotes */
00911     
00912     else if ( in_out_argv[i][0] == '\'' )
00913     {
00914       
00915       if ( remove_quotes( '\'', &(in_out_argv[i]) ) )
00916       {
00917         shell_PrintError( context,"Syntax error: Missing closing quote" );
00918         error = SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
00919         break;
00920       }
00921       
00922       if ( unescape( in_out_argv[i] ))
00923       {
00924         shell_PrintError( context,"Syntax error: Invalid escape sequence" );
00925         error = SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
00926         break;
00927       }
00928       
00929     }
00930         
00931     /* var name */
00932     
00933     else if ( in_out_argv[i][0] == '$' )
00934     {
00935       
00936       char * value = get_var_value( &(in_out_argv[i][1]) );
00937       
00938       if (value)
00939         in_out_argv[i] = value;
00940       else
00941       {
00942         snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
00943             "Undefined variable \"%s\"", &(in_out_argv[i][1]) );
00944         shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
00945         error = SHELL_NOT_FOUND;
00946         break;
00947       }
00948     
00949     }
00950     
00951     /* command */
00952     
00953     else if ( in_out_argv[i][0] == '`' )
00954     {
00955       
00956       char * arglist[MAX_ARGS];
00957       int argcount;
00958       int rc,status;
00959       
00960       /* remove quotes */
00961       
00962       if ( remove_quotes( '`', &(in_out_argv[i]) ) )
00963       {
00964         shell_PrintError( context, "Syntax error: Missing closing backquote" );
00965         error = SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
00966         break;
00967       }
00968       
00969       if ( unescape( in_out_argv[i] ) )
00970       {
00971         shell_PrintError( context, "Syntax error: Invalid escape sequence" );
00972         error = SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
00973         break;
00974       }
00975 
00976       
00977       /* Parse command line */
00978 
00979       if ( shell_ParseLine( in_out_argv[i], arglist, &argcount) )
00980       {
00981         error = SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
00982         break;
00983       }
00984       
00985       /* nothing to do if the command is empty. */
00986       
00987       if ( argcount == 0 )
00988       {
00989         
00990         /* empty output */
00991         in_out_argv[i][0] = '\0';
00992         
00993         /* command status */
00994         shell_SetStatus( context, 0 );
00995 
00996       }
00997       else
00998       {
00999         
01000         int fd[2];
01001         FILE * output_stream;
01002         int alloctab[MAX_ARGS];
01003         
01004         char output_string[MAX_OUTPUT_LEN];
01005         
01006         /* Evaluates arguments */
01007 
01008         if ( shell_SolveArgs( argcount, arglist, alloctab ) )
01009         {
01010           error = SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
01011           break;
01012         }
01013         
01014         /* create pipe for command output */
01015         
01016         if ( pipe(fd) )
01017         {
01018           
01019           snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "Can't create pipe: %s (%d)",
01020                     strerror(errno) , errno );
01021           shell_PrintError(context, tracebuff);
01022           
01023           /* clean allocated strings */
01024           shell_CleanArgs( argcount, arglist, alloctab );
01025           
01026           error = errno;
01027           break;
01028           
01029         }
01030         
01031         /* opening output stream */
01032         
01033         output_stream = fdopen( fd[1], "a" );
01034          
01035         if ( output_stream == NULL )
01036         {
01037           
01038           snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "Can't open pipe stream: %s (%d)",
01039                     strerror(errno) , errno );
01040           shell_PrintError(context,tracebuff);
01041           
01042           /* clean allocated strings */
01043           shell_CleanArgs( argcount, arglist, alloctab );
01044           
01045           /* close pipe */
01046           close(fd[1]);
01047           close(fd[0]);
01048           
01049           error = errno;
01050           break;
01051           
01052         }
01053 
01054         /* @todo : thread for pipe reading */
01055                 
01056         /* Execute command */
01057         
01058         status = shell_Execute( argcount, arglist, output_stream );
01059         
01060         /* closing ouput stream. */
01061         
01062         fclose( output_stream );
01063         close(fd[1]);
01064         
01065         /* clean allocated strings */
01066         shell_CleanArgs( argcount, arglist, alloctab );
01067         
01068         
01069         /* read the output from pipe */
01070         
01071         rc = read( fd[0], output_string, MAX_OUTPUT_LEN );
01072         
01073         /* close pipe */
01074         close(fd[0]);
01075         
01076         if ( rc == -1 )
01077         {
01078           snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "Cannot read from pipe: %s (%d)",
01079                     strerror(errno) , errno );
01080           shell_PrintError(context,tracebuff);
01081           
01082           error = errno;
01083           break;
01084         }        
01085         
01086         /* allocate and fill output buffer */
01087         
01088         in_out_argv[i] = Mem_Alloc(rc+1);
01089         
01090         if ( in_out_argv[i] == NULL)
01091         {
01092           shell_PrintError( context, "Malloc error");
01093           error = -1;
01094           break;
01095         }
01096         
01097         memcpy( in_out_argv[i], output_string, rc);
01098         
01099         out_allocated[i] = TRUE;
01100         
01101         in_out_argv[i][rc] = '\0';
01102         
01103         /* set command status */
01104         
01105         shell_SetStatus( context, status );
01106 
01107       }
01108       
01109     
01110     }
01111     /*  normal arg  */ 
01112     else
01113     {      
01114       if ( unescape( in_out_argv[i] ) )
01115       {
01116         shell_PrintError( context, "Syntax error: Invalid escape sequence" );
01117         error = SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
01118         break;
01119       }
01120 
01121     }  /* in_out_argv[i][0] */
01122     
01123   } /* for */
01124   
01125   
01126   /* the case when we exited the for because of an error. */
01127   
01128   if ( error )
01129   {
01130     /* free allocated strings */
01131     shell_CleanArgs( i+1, in_out_argv, out_allocated);
01132     return error;
01133   }
01134     
01135   
01136   return SHELL_SUCCESS;  
01137   
01138 } /* shell_SolveArgs */
01139 
01140 
01141 
01152 void shell_CleanArgs( int argc, char ** in_out_argv, int * in_allocated )
01153 {
01154   
01155   int i;
01156   
01157   for ( i=0; i<argc; i++ )
01158   {
01159     
01160     if ( in_allocated[i] )
01161     {
01162       Mem_Free( in_out_argv[i] );
01163       in_out_argv[i] = NULL;
01164       in_allocated[i] = FALSE;      
01165     }
01166     
01167   }
01168   
01169   return;  
01170   
01171 }
01172 
01173 
01174 
01185 int shell_Execute( int argc, char ** argv, FILE * output )
01186 {
01187   
01188   /* pointer to the command to be launched */
01189   int  (*command_func)(int,char **,FILE *) = NULL ;
01190   
01191   int i;
01192   int rc;
01193   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01194   
01195   shell_state_t  * context =   GetShellContext();  
01196 
01197   /* First, look at shell internal commands */ 
01198   
01199   for ( i=0; shell_commands[i].command_name; i++ )
01200   {
01201     if ( !strcmp( argv[0],shell_commands[i].command_name ) )
01202     {
01203        command_func = shell_commands[i].command_func ;
01204        break;
01205     }
01206   }
01207   
01208   
01209   /* If not found, look at shell utils commands */
01210   
01211   if ( ! command_func )
01212   {
01213   
01214     for ( i=0; shell_utils[i].command_name; i++ )
01215     {
01216       if ( !strcmp( argv[0],shell_utils[i].command_name ) )
01217       {
01218          command_func = shell_utils[i].command_func ;
01219          break;
01220       }
01221     }
01222     
01223   }
01224 
01225     
01226   /* If not found, look at layer commands */
01227   
01228   if ( ! command_func )
01229   {
01230     layer_def_t * current_layer = shell_GetLayer( context );
01231     
01232     if ( current_layer )
01233     {
01234     
01235       for ( i=0; current_layer->command_list[i].command_name; i++ )
01236       {
01237         if ( !strcmp( argv[0],current_layer->command_list[i].command_name ) )
01238         {
01239            command_func = current_layer->command_list[i].command_func ;
01240            
01241            /* set layer's debug level */
01242            current_layer->setlog_func( shell_GetDbgLvl(context) );
01243            
01244            break;
01245         }
01246       } /* for */
01247       
01248     }/* if current_layer */
01249     
01250   } /* if command_func */
01251   
01252   
01253   /* command not found */
01254   
01255   if ( ! command_func ) {
01256     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "%s: command not found", argv[0]);
01257     shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );    
01258     return SHELL_NOT_FOUND;
01259   }
01260   
01261   /* verbose trace */
01262   
01263   if ( shell_GetVerbose( context ) )
01264   {
01265     tracebuff[0]='\0';
01266     for ( i = 0; i < argc; i ++ )
01267     {
01268       /* + 1 = size of the additional char ( + or space) */
01269       size_t len1 = strlen( tracebuff ) + 1;
01270       size_t len2 = strlen( argv[i] );
01271             
01272       if ( len1 > TRACEBUFFSIZE - 1 ) break;
01273 
01274       if ( i != 0 ) strcat( tracebuff, " " );
01275       else strcat( tracebuff, "+" );
01276 
01277       if ( len1 + len2 > TRACEBUFFSIZE - 1 )
01278       {
01279         if ( TRACEBUFFSIZE - 6 - len1 > 0 )
01280           strncat( tracebuff, argv[i], TRACEBUFFSIZE - 6 - len1 );
01281 
01282         strcat( tracebuff, "[...]" );
01283         break;
01284       }
01285       else
01286       {
01287         strcat(tracebuff,  argv[i] );
01288       }
01289 
01290     }
01291   }
01292   shell_PrintTrace( context, tracebuff );
01293   
01294   /* execute the command */
01295   
01296   rc =  command_func( argc, argv, output );
01297   
01298   /* verbose trace */
01299   
01300   snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "%s returned %d", argv[0], rc );
01301   shell_PrintTrace( context, tracebuff );
01302   
01303   return rc;
01304   
01305 } /* shell_Execute */
01306                     
01307 
01308 
01309 
01310 /*------------------------------------------------------------------
01311  *                 Shell ouput routines.
01312  *-----------------------------------------------------------------*/
01313 
01314 
01319 void shell_PrintError(   shell_state_t  * context, char * error_msg )
01320 {
01321   
01322   char * input_name = get_var_value( "INPUT" );
01323   
01324   fprintf( stderr, "******* ERROR in %s line %d: %s\n",
01325            ( input_name ? input_name : "?" ),
01326            shell_GetLine( context ),
01327            error_msg
01328           );
01329   
01330 }
01331 
01332 
01337 void shell_PrintTrace(shell_state_t  * context, char * msg )
01338 {
01339   
01340   char * input_name;
01341   
01342   if ( shell_GetVerbose( context ) )
01343   {
01344     input_name = get_var_value( "INPUT" );
01345   
01346     fprintf( stderr, "%s l.%d: %s\n",
01347              ( input_name ? input_name : "?" ),
01348              shell_GetLine(context),
01349              msg
01350             );
01351   }
01352     
01353 }
01354 
01355 
01356 
01357 /*------------------------------------------------------------------
01358  *                 Shell state management routines.
01359  *-----------------------------------------------------------------*/
01360 
01361 
01368 int shell_SetLayer( shell_state_t * context, char * layer_name )
01369 {
01370   
01371   layer_def_t * layer = NULL;
01372   int i, rc;
01373   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01374   
01375   /* search for layer */
01376   
01377   for ( i=0; layer_list[i].layer_name; i++ )
01378   {
01379     if (!strcasecmp(layer_name,layer_list[i].layer_name))
01380     {
01381        layer = &layer_list[i];
01382        break;
01383     }
01384   }
01385 
01386   /* saves current layer */
01387   
01388   if ( layer )
01389   {
01390     /* saves layer pointer */
01391     
01392     context->layer = layer;
01393     
01394     /* stores layer name into vars  */
01395     
01396     rc = set_var_value("LAYER", layer->layer_name );
01397     
01398     if ( rc != 0 )
01399     {
01400       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01401           "Error %d setting LAYER value to %s", rc, layer->layer_name );
01402       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01403     }
01404     
01405     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01406         "Current layer is now %s", layer->layer_name );
01407     shell_PrintTrace( context, tracebuff );
01408     
01409     return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01410     
01411   }
01412   else
01413   {
01414     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "Layer not found: %s", layer_name );
01415     shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01416     return SHELL_NOT_FOUND;
01417   }
01418   
01419   
01420 } /* shell_SetLayer */
01421 
01422 
01423 
01428 layer_def_t * shell_GetLayer( shell_state_t * context )
01429 {
01430   
01431   return context->layer;
01432   
01433 }
01434 
01435 
01440 int shell_SetStatus( shell_state_t * context, int returned_status )
01441 {
01442   
01443   int rc;
01444   char str_int[64];
01445   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01446     
01447   context->status = returned_status;
01448   
01449   snprintf( str_int, 64, "%d", returned_status);
01450   
01451   rc = set_var_value( "STATUS", str_int );
01452   
01453   if ( rc != 0 )
01454   {
01455     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01456         "Error %d setting STATUS value to %s", rc, str_int );
01457     shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01458   }
01459   
01460   rc = set_var_value( "?", str_int );
01461   
01462   if ( rc != 0 )
01463   {
01464     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01465         "Error %d setting ? value to %s", rc, str_int );
01466     shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01467   }
01468   
01469   return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01470   
01471 }
01472 
01473 
01478 int shell_GetStatus( shell_state_t * context )
01479 {
01480   return context->status;
01481 }
01482 
01483 
01488 int shell_SetVerbose( shell_state_t * context, char * str_verbose )
01489 {
01490 
01491   int rc;
01492   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01493     
01494   if (
01495        !strcasecmp(str_verbose,"ON") ||
01496        !strcasecmp(str_verbose,"TRUE") ||
01497        !strcasecmp(str_verbose,"YES") ||
01498        !strcmp(str_verbose,"1")
01499       )
01500   {
01501     context->verbose = TRUE;
01502 
01503     rc = set_var_value( "VERBOSE", "1" );
01504 
01505     if ( rc != 0 )
01506     {
01507       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01508           "Error %d setting VERBOSE value to %s", rc, "1" );
01509       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01510     }
01511     
01512     return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01513 
01514   }
01515   else if (
01516        !strcasecmp(str_verbose,"OFF") ||
01517        !strcasecmp(str_verbose,"FALSE") ||
01518        !strcasecmp(str_verbose,"NO") ||
01519        !strcmp(str_verbose,"0")
01520       )
01521   {
01522     context->verbose = FALSE;
01523 
01524     rc = set_var_value( "VERBOSE", "0" );
01525 
01526     if ( rc != 0 )
01527     {
01528       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01529           "Error %d setting VERBOSE value to %s", rc, "0" );
01530       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01531     }
01532     
01533     return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01534 
01535   }
01536   else
01537   {
01538     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01539         "Unexpected value for VERBOSE: %s", str_verbose );
01540     shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01541     
01542     return SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
01543   }
01544   
01545 }
01546 
01547 
01552 int shell_GetVerbose( shell_state_t * context )
01553 {
01554   return context->verbose;
01555 }
01556 
01557 
01562 int shell_SetDbgLvl( shell_state_t * context, char * str_debug_level )
01563 {
01564   int level_debug;
01565   int rc;
01566   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01567   
01568   level_debug = ReturnLevelAscii( str_debug_level );
01569   
01570   if ( level_debug != -1 )
01571   {
01572     /* set shell state */
01573     context->debug_level = level_debug;
01574     
01575     /* call to logfunctions */
01576     SetLevelDebug( level_debug );
01577     
01578     /* set shell vars */
01579     
01580     rc = set_var_value( "DEBUG_LEVEL", str_debug_level );
01581 
01582     if ( rc != 0 )
01583     {
01584       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01585           "Error %d setting DEBUG_LEVEL value to %s", rc, str_debug_level );
01586       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01587     }
01588     
01589     rc = set_var_value( "DBG_LVL", str_debug_level );
01590 
01591     if ( rc != 0 )
01592     {
01593       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01594           "Error %d setting DBG_LVL value to %s", rc, str_debug_level );
01595       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01596     }
01597     
01598     return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01599     
01600   }
01601   else
01602   {
01603     
01604     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01605       "Unexpected value for DEBUG_LEVEL: %s", str_debug_level );
01606     shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01607     
01608     return SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
01609   }
01610 
01611   
01612 } /* shell_SetDbgLvl */
01613 
01614 
01615 
01620 int shell_GetDbgLvl( shell_state_t * context )
01621 {
01622   return context->debug_level;
01623 }
01624 
01625 
01626 
01635 int shell_SetInput( shell_state_t * context, char * file_name )
01636 {
01637   
01638   FILE * stream;
01639   int rc;
01640   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01641   
01642   if ( file_name )
01643   {
01644     if ( (stream = fopen(file_name, "r")) == NULL )
01645     {
01646       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "Can't open \"%s\": %s (%d)",
01647          file_name, strerror(errno) , errno ); 
01648       shell_PrintError(context, tracebuff);
01649       return errno;
01650     }
01651         
01652     
01653     /* close previous filestream and reset line number */
01654     if ( context->input_stream != NULL )
01655     {
01656       /* don't close stdin */
01657       if (context->input_stream != stdin)
01658         fclose( context->input_stream );
01659       
01660       shell_SetLine( context, 0 );
01661     }
01662     
01663     
01664     /* set filestream */
01665     context->input_stream = stream;
01666 
01667     rc = set_var_value( "INPUT", file_name );
01668 
01669     if ( rc != 0 )
01670     {
01671       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01672           "Error %d setting INPUT value to \"%s\"", rc, file_name );
01673       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01674     }    
01675     
01676     /* set interative mode to FALSE */
01677     
01678     context->interactive = FALSE;
01679     
01680     rc = set_var_value( "INTERACTIVE", "0" );
01681 
01682     if ( rc != 0 )
01683     {
01684       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01685           "Error %d setting INTERACTIVE value to %s", rc, "0" );
01686       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01687     }    
01688 
01689     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "Using script file \"%s\"",file_name);
01690     shell_PrintTrace( context, tracebuff );
01691     
01692     return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01693         
01694 
01695   }
01696   else
01697   {
01698     stream = stdin;
01699         
01700     /* close previous filestream and reset line number */
01701     if ( context->input_stream != NULL )
01702     {
01703       /* don't close stdin */
01704       if (context->input_stream != stdin)
01705         fclose( context->input_stream );
01706       shell_SetLine( context, 0 );
01707     }
01708     
01709     /* set filestream */
01710     context->input_stream = stream;
01711 
01712     rc = set_var_value( "INPUT", "<stdin>" );
01713 
01714     if ( rc != 0 )
01715     {
01716       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01717           "Error %d setting INPUT value to %s", rc, "<stdin>" );
01718       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01719     }    
01720     
01721     /* set interative mode to TRUE */
01722     
01723     context->interactive = TRUE;
01724     
01725     rc = set_var_value( "INTERACTIVE", "1" );
01726 
01727     if ( rc != 0 )
01728     {
01729       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01730           "Error %d setting INTERACTIVE value to %s", rc, "1" );
01731       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01732     }    
01733 
01734     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "Using standard input");
01735     shell_PrintTrace( context, tracebuff );
01736     
01737     return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01738     
01739     
01740   }
01741   
01742 } /* shell_SetInput */
01743 
01744 
01745 
01750 FILE * shell_GetInputStream( shell_state_t * context )
01751 {
01752   if ( context->input_stream )
01753     return context->input_stream;
01754   else
01755     return stdin;
01756 }

01760 
01765 int shell_SetPrompt( shell_state_t * context, char * str_prompt )
01766 {
01767     int rc = set_var_value( "PROMPT", str_prompt );
01768     char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01769 
01770     if ( rc != 0 )
01771     {
01772       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01773           "Error %d setting PROMPT value to \"%s\"", rc, str_prompt );
01774       shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01775     }
01776     
01777     return rc;  
01778 }

01797 int shell_SetShellId( shell_state_t * context, int shell_index )
01798 {
01799   int rc;
01800   char str[64];
01801   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01802   
01803   snprintf(str, 64, "%d",shell_index);
01804  
01805   rc = set_var_value( "SHELLID", str );
01806   
01807   if ( rc != 0 )
01808   {
01809     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01810         "Error %d setting SHELLID value to \"%s\"", rc, str );
01811     shell_PrintError( context, tracebuff );
01812   }
01813     
01814   return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01815 }

01823 int shell_SetLine( shell_state_t * context, int lineno )
01824 {

01826   char str_line[64];
01827   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01828   
01829   context->line = lineno;
01830   
01831   snprintf(str_line, 64, "%d",lineno);
01832  
01833   rc = set_var_value( "LINE", str_line );
01834   
01835   if ( rc != 0 )
01836   {
01837     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01838         "Error %d setting LINE value to \"%s\"", rc, str_line );

01840   }
01841     
01842   return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01843

01859 /*------------------------------------------------------------------
01860  *                      Shell commands.
01861  *-----------------------------------------------------------------*/
01862 
01863  
01864 int shellcmd_help(
01865                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01866                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01867                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
01868                   )
01869 {
01870   
01871   int i;
01872   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
01873   layer_def_t * current_layer = shell_GetLayer(GetShellContext());
01874   
01875   
01876   /* check args */
01877   
01878   if ( argc>1 )
01879   {
01880     for ( i=1; i<argc; i++)
01881     {
01882       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
01883           "%s: Unexpected argument \"%s\"", argv[0], argv[i] );
01884       shell_PrintError( GetShellContext(), tracebuff );
01885     }
01886   }
01887   
01888   /* List shell build-in commands */
01889   
01890   fprintf(output, "Shell built-in commands:\n");
01891   
01892   for ( i=0; shell_commands[i].command_name; i++ )
01893   {
01894     fprintf(output, "   %15s: %s\n", shell_commands[i].command_name,
01895                                    shell_commands[i].command_help );
01896   }
01897   
01898 
01899   /* List shell tools commands */
01900 
01901   fprintf(output, "\nShell tools commands:\n");
01902   
01903   for ( i=0; shell_utils[i].command_name; i++ )
01904   {
01905     fprintf(output, "   %15s: %s\n", shell_utils[i].command_name,
01906                                    shell_utils[i].command_help );
01907   }
01908 
01909   /* Layer list */  
01910   
01911   fprintf(output, "\nLayers list:\n");
01912   
01913   for ( i=0; layer_list[i].layer_name; i++ )
01914   {
01915     fprintf(output, "   %15s: %s\n", layer_list[i].layer_name,
01916                                    layer_list[i].layer_description );
01917   }
01918 
01919   /* Layer commands */  
01920   
01921   if ( current_layer )
01922   {
01923   
01924   fprintf(output, "\n%s layer commands:\n", current_layer->layer_name );
01925   
01926     for ( i=0; current_layer->command_list[i].command_name; i++ )
01927     {
01928       fprintf(output, "   %15s: %s\n", current_layer->command_list[i].command_name,
01929                                      current_layer->command_list[i].command_help );
01930     }
01931     
01932   }
01933   
01934   
01935   return SHELL_SUCCESS;
01936       
01937 } /* shellcmd_help */
01938 
01939 
01940 
01941 int shellcmd_if(
01942                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01943                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01944                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
01945                   )
01946 {
01947 
01948   int i, rc;
01949   int index_test    = -1;
01950   int longueur_test = -1;
01951   int index_cmd1    = -1;
01952   int longueur_cmd1 = -1;
01953   int index_cmd2    = -1;
01954   int longueur_cmd2 = -1;
01955   
01956   static char * help_if =
01957       "Usage: if command0 ? command1 [: command2]\n"
01958       "   Execute command1 if command0 returns a null status.\n"
01959       "   Else, execute command2 (if any).\n"
01960       "Ex: if eq -n $STATUS 0 ? print \"status=0\" : print \"status<>0\" \n";
01961     
01962   
01963   /* first, check that there is a test */
01964   if ( argc > 1 )
01965   {
01966   
01967     index_test = 1;
01968     
01969     i = index_test + 1;
01970     
01971     /* look for command 1 */
01972         
01973     while ( ( i < argc ) && strcmp( argv[i], "?" ) ) i++;
01974       
01975     if ( i+1 < argc )
01976     {
01977       longueur_test = i - index_test;
01978       index_cmd1 = i+1;
01979       
01980       i = index_cmd1 + 1;
01981 
01982       /* look for command 2 */
01983       
01984       while ( ( i < argc ) && strcmp( argv[i], ":" ) ) i++;
01985       
01986       if ( i+1 < argc )
01987       {
01988         longueur_cmd1 = i - index_cmd1;
01989         index_cmd2 = i+1;
01990         longueur_cmd2 = argc - index_cmd2;
01991       }
01992       else
01993       {
01994         longueur_cmd1 = argc - index_cmd1;
01995       }
01996       
01997     }
01998     else
01999     {
02000       longueur_test = argc - index_test;
02001     }
02002     
02003   }
02004   
02005   /* test or cmd1 missing */
02006   
02007   if ( ( longueur_test <= 0 ) || ( longueur_cmd1 <= 0 ) )
02008   {
02009     fprintf(output,help_if);
02010     return SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;    
02011   }
02012   
02013   /* executes test */
02014   
02015   rc = shell_Execute( longueur_test, &(argv[index_test]), output );
02016   
02017     
02018   /* if rc is not null, executes command 1 */
02019   if (rc)
02020   {
02021     return shell_Execute( longueur_cmd1, &(argv[index_cmd1]), output );
02022   }
02023   else if (longueur_cmd2 > 0)
02024   {
02025     return shell_Execute( longueur_cmd2, &(argv[index_cmd2]), output );
02026   }
02027   
02028   return 0;
02029     
02030 } /* shellcmd_if */
02031

02035 int shellcmd_interactive(
02036                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02037                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02038                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02039                   )
02040 {
02041   int i;
02042   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
02043   
02044   /* check args */
02045   
02046   if ( argc>1 )
02047   {
02048     for ( i=1; i<argc; i++)
02049     {
02050       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
02051           "%s: Unexpected argument \"%s\"", argv[0], argv[i] );
02052       shell_PrintError( GetShellContext(), tracebuff );
02053     }
02054   }
02055   
02056   /* set input as stdin */
02057   
02058   return shell_SetInput( GetShellContext(), NULL );
02059     
02060 } /* shellcmd_interactive */

02063 
02064 
02065 int shellcmd_set(
02066                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02067                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02068                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02069                   )
02070 { 
02071   
02072   int i;
02073   char * varname;
02074   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
02075   char varvalue[MAX_OUTPUT_LEN];
02076   
02077   /* check args */
02078 
02079   if ( argc < 3 )
02080   {
02081     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
02082         "%s: Usage: %s <var_name> <expr1> [<expr2> ...<exprN>]",argv[0],argv[0] );
02083     shell_PrintError(GetShellContext(), tracebuff);
02084         
02085     return SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
02086   }
02087   
02088   varname = argv[1];
02089     
02090   varvalue[0] = '\0';
02091       
02092   /* concatenation of strings */
02093   
02094   for ( i = 2; i < argc ; i++)
02095     if ( concat( varvalue , argv[i], MAX_OUTPUT_LEN ) == NULL )
02096     {
02097       shell_PrintError(GetShellContext(), "Output too large.");
02098       return SHELL_ERROR;
02099     }
02100     
02101   
02102   /* special variables */
02103   
02104   if (!strcmp(varname, "INPUT"))
02105   {
02106     return shell_SetInput(GetShellContext(), varvalue);
02107   }
02108   else if (!strcmp(varname, "INTERACTIVE"))
02109   {
02110     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
02111         "%s: cannot set \"%s\": set the value of \"INPUT\" or use the \"interactive\" command instead.",
02112         argv[0],varname );
02113     shell_PrintError(GetShellContext(), tracebuff);
02114         
02115     return SHELL_ERROR;
02116     
02117   }
02118   else if (!strcmp(varname, "LAYER"))
02119   {
02120     return shell_SetLayer( GetShellContext(), varvalue );
02121   }
02122   else if (!strcmp(varname, "STATUS") || !strcmp(varname, "?") )
02123   {
02124     return shell_SetStatus( GetShellContext(), my_atoi( varvalue ) );
02125   }
02126   else if (!strcmp(varname, "VERBOSE") )
02127   {
02128     return shell_SetVerbose( GetShellContext(), varvalue );
02129   }
02130   else if ( !strcmp(varname, "DEBUG_LEVEL") || !strcmp(varname, "DBG_LVL"))
02131   {
02132     return shell_SetDbgLvl( GetShellContext(), varvalue );
02133   }
02134   else if ( !strcmp(varname, "PROMPT"))
02135   {
02136     return shell_SetPrompt( GetShellContext(), varvalue );
02137   }
02138   else if ( !strcmp(varname, "LINE"))
02139   {
02140     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "%s: cannot set \"%s\".", argv[0], varname );
02141     shell_PrintError(GetShellContext(), tracebuff);        
02142     return SHELL_ERROR;
02143   }
02144   else
02145   {  
02146     
02147     
02148     /* other variables */
02149     
02150     if ( !is_authorized_varname(varname) )
02151     {
02152       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "%s: Invalid variable name \"%s\".", argv[0], varname );
02153       shell_PrintError(GetShellContext(), tracebuff);
02154       return SHELL_ERROR;      
02155     }
02156 
02157     if ( set_var_value( varname, varvalue) )
02158     {
02159       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE, "%s: Error setting the value of \"%s\".", argv[0], varname );
02160       shell_PrintError(GetShellContext(), tracebuff);
02161       return SHELL_ERROR;
02162     }
02163     
02164     return SHELL_SUCCESS;
02165     
02166   }  
02167   
02168   
02169   /* should never happen */
02170   return SHELL_ERROR;
02171   
02172 } /* shellcmd_set */
02173 
02174 
02175 
02176 
02177 int shellcmd_unset(
02178                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02179                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02180                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02181                   )
02182 { 
02183   
02184   int i, arg_idx;
02185   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
02186   int error = SHELL_SUCCESS;
02187 
02188   if ( argc<=1 )
02189   {
02190     snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
02191         "%s: Missing argument: <var name>",argv[0] );
02192     shell_PrintError(GetShellContext(), tracebuff);
02193         
02194     return SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
02195   }
02196 
02197   
02198   for ( arg_idx = 1 ; arg_idx < argc ; arg_idx ++ )
02199   {  
02200   
02201     /* check if it is not a special var */
02202 
02203     for ( i=0; shell_special_vars[i] != NULL ; i++ )
02204     {
02205 
02206       if ( !strcmp( shell_special_vars[i], argv[arg_idx] ) )
02207       {
02208         
02209         snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
02210             "%s: This special variable cannot be deleted: \"%s\"",argv[0],
02211             argv[arg_idx] );
02212         shell_PrintError( GetShellContext(), tracebuff );
02213         
02214         return SHELL_ERROR;
02215         
02216       }
02217 
02218     }
02219     
02220     /* unset the variable */
02221     
02222     if ( free_var( argv[arg_idx] ) )
02223     {
02224       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
02225             "%s: Variable not found: \"%s\"",argv[0], argv[arg_idx] );
02226       shell_PrintError( GetShellContext(), tracebuff );
02227       
02228       error = SHELL_NOT_FOUND;
02229       /* however, continue */
02230     }
02231     
02232   }
02233     
02234   return error;
02235   
02236 } /* shellcmd_unset */

02292 
02293 int shellcmd_time(
02294                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02295                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02296                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02297                   )
02298 {
02299   
02300   static char * help_time =
02301       "Usage: time command [args ...]\n"
02302       "   Measure the time for executing a command.\n"
02303       "Ex: time shell ls\n";
02304     
02305   struct timeval timer_start;
02306   struct timeval timer_stop;
02307   struct timeval timer_tmp;
02308 
02309   int rc;
02310       
02311   /* first, check that there is a test */
02312   if ( argc < 2 )
02313   {
02314     fprintf(output,help_time);
02315     return SHELL_SYNTAX_ERROR;
02316   }
02317   
02318   if ( gettimeofday(&timer_start,NULL)== -1 ){
02319     fprintf(output,"Error retrieving system time.\n");
02320     return SHELL_ERROR;
02321   }
02322   
02323   rc = shell_Execute( argc - 1 , &(argv[1]), output );
02324 
02325   if ( gettimeofday(&timer_stop,NULL)== -1 ){
02326     fprintf(output,"Error retrieving system time.\n");
02327     return SHELL_ERROR;
02328   }
02329   
02330   timer_tmp = time_diff( timer_start, timer_stop );
02331   fprintf(output,"\nExecution time for command \"%s\": ",argv[1]);
02332   print_timeval( output, timer_tmp );
02333   
02334   return rc;
02335   
02336 } /* shellcmd_time */

02340 int shellcmd_quit(
02341                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02342                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02343                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02344                   )
02345 {
02346   int i;
02347   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
02348   
02349   /* check args */
02350   
02351   if ( argc>1 )
02352   {
02353     for ( i=1; i<argc; i++)
02354     {
02355       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
02356           "%s: Unexpected argument \"%s\"", argv[0], argv[i] );
02357       shell_PrintError( GetShellContext(), tracebuff );
02358     }
02359   }
02360   
02361   exit(0);
02362   return 0;
02363   
02364 } /* shellcmd_quit */

02367 
02368 int shellcmd_barrier(
02369                    int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02370                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02371                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02372                   )
02373 {
02374   int i;
02375   char tracebuff[TRACEBUFFSIZE];
02376   
02377   /* check args */
02378   
02379   if ( argc>1 )
02380   {
02381     for ( i=1; i<argc; i++)
02382     {
02383       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
02384           "%s: Unexpected argument \"%s\"", argv[0], argv[i] );
02385       shell_PrintError( GetShellContext(), tracebuff );
02386     }
02387   }
02388   
02389   /* call shell_BarrierWait */
02390   
02391   if ( shell_BarrierWait() )
02392   {
02393       snprintf( tracebuff, TRACEBUFFSIZE,
02394           "%s: barrier cannot be used in a single thread/script environment.", argv[0] );
02395       shell_PrintError( GetShellContext(), tracebuff );
02396       return SHELL_ERROR;
02397   }
02398       
02399   return SHELL_SUCCESS;
02400   
02401 } /* shellcmd_quit */
